intro: Psychotria spiciflora, commonly known as the spicate psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in humid, shaded forest understories. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by various bird species. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
